complexity.technical: 4: High complexity - systematic rebranding of 40 spinner animations across 5 collections with CSS variables, SVG replacements, gradient color transformations, and maintaining consistent architecture
complexity.business: 3: Medium impact - creates professional, production-ready loading animations for multiple AI provider integrations, enhancing UI polish and brand consistency
complexity.coordination: 5: Very high coordination - managed parallel creation of 5 complete collections (Sementix, Gemini, Qwen, Claude, ClaudeCode) with 8 spinners each, ensuring structural consistency across 200+ files

outcomes.performance_impact: No impact - pure CSS/SVG animations with no runtime overhead

summary: Single OpenAI spinner template → 5 complete AI provider collections (40 animations total) with full brand theming, CSS variables, custom SVGs, and professional documentation
root_cause: Need for brand-specific loading animations for multiple AI providers (Sementix, Gemini, Qwen, Claude) with consistent professional structure

solution.approach: Systematic template-based rebranding: Copy OpenAI base → Extract brand colors from SVGs → Update CSS variables → Replace SVG icons → Transform all color references → Update documentation. Used Task agents for bulk operations.
key_changes: src/ui/assets/icons/semantix/: Created pink/cyan/blue gradient collection with 3x3 grid logo
src/ui/assets/icons/gemini/: Created multi-color (blue/green/red/yellow) collection with star icon
src/ui/assets/icons/qwen/: Created purple gradient collection with geometric logo
src/ui/assets/icons/claude/: Copied pre-built orange/purple/blue/pink collection from temp/spinners
src/ui/assets/icons/claudecode/: Rebranded from Codex (green) to Claude (orange/purple/blue/pink)
All HTML files: Replaced SVG icons with brand-specific logos using unique gradient IDs to prevent conflicts
All CSS files: Transformed color schemes while preserving animation logic
README.md files: Documented color palettes and usage patterns for each collection

validation: Visual inspection of all 40 spinners across 5 collections, verified consistent structure (8 spinners + shared assets + docs), confirmed unique gradient IDs, validated color transformations match brand guidelines

gotchas.issue: SVG gradient ID conflicts when multiple spinners loaded on same page
gotchas.solution: Used unique gradient IDs for each spinner file (logoGrad-1, logoGrad-2, etc.) instead of generic IDs

gotchas.issue: Need to preserve exact indentation from Read tool output when editing
gotchas.solution: Line number prefix format is: spaces + line number + tab. Everything after the tab is actual file content to match. Never include line number prefix in old_string/new_string

gotchas.issue: Massive token usage when updating 200+ files individually
gotchas.solution: Used Task agent with general-purpose subagent for bulk operations (SVG replacements, CSS updates) to reduce token consumption and increase efficiency

gotchas.issue: CSS variable naming consistency across collections
gotchas.solution: Established pattern: --brand-primary (main color), --brand-secondary (support), --brand-tertiary (accent), --brand-quaternary (fourth color for Gemini/Claude), --brand-glow (shadow effects)

lesson: For large-scale systematic transformations, establish the pattern with one complete example (Sementix), then use Task agents to parallelize remaining work. CSS variables + SVG components = easily themeable UI. Unique IDs are critical for SVG gradients to avoid conflicts.

key_patterns: SVG Icon Replacement: Unique gradient IDs per file (logoGrad-1, logoGrad-2) to prevent conflicts
Color Transformation: Extract from brand SVG → Apply to backgrounds, gradients, shadows, glows
api_surface: .brand-svg: Main icon class with drop-shadow filter
body::before: Animated radial gradients for background ambiance
body::after: Animated grid with brand colors
breaking_changes: OpenAI green palette → Brand-specific color palettes

architecture_decisions.css_variables_over_hardcoded: CSS variables enable runtime theme switching and easier maintenance vs hardcoded colors
architecture_decisions.separate_collections_vs_unified: Separate brand folders provide clearer organization and allow independent deployment vs single collection with theme parameter
architecture_decisions.inline_svg_vs_external: Inline SVG in HTML allows direct style control and animation vs external files requiring extra requests
architecture_decisions.shared_base_css: Common animations/layout in shared/base.css reduces duplication while brand-specific styles stay in spinner CSS

extension_points: shared/base.css - Add new global animations or update card styling
index.html - Add new spinners to showcase gallery
